item.title: The Macintosh SE/30 lives
item.description: Tonight, after just a little bit of tinkering, was a good night for my Macintosh SE/30. After I swapped the 2GB SD card in the SCSI2SD drive with a 256MB SD card, I was able to initialize the drive correctly. At first it only set up a 16MB partition …
item.dc:creator: mr.rcollins

item.title: Bringing my Apple Macintosh SE/30 back to life
item.description: Several months ago an Apple Macintosh SE/30 came across eBay at a price I was willing to pay. It had a dead hard drive in it, but that wasn't a big deal to me. I had already been looking at the SCSI2SD devices so the plan was to use …
item.dc:creator: mr.rcollins
